alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 10:26PM MST until January 28 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...A prolonged period of light to moderate snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...East Central Wyoming into the northern Nebraska Panhandle including Converse and Niobrara Counties in Wyoming, and Sioux and Dawes County in Nebraska. This includes the cities of Douglas, Lusk, Harrison, and Chadron. The highest totals will be found along the Pine Ridge. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Saturday. A second wave of snow will be possible on Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
